intro: Psychotria sordida, commonly known as the dark psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly found in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically dark blue or black when mature. Psychotria sordida is often found in shaded understory environments and is known for its ecological importance in supporting various insect and bird species.
